org.gbif.crawler.protocol.tapir

Class TapirResponseHandler

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.gbif.crawler.protocol.AbstractResponseHandler
      • org.gbif.crawler.protocol.tapir.TapirResponseHandler
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    ResponseHandler<org.apache.http.HttpResponse,List<Byte>>

    @NotThreadSafe
public class TapirResponseHandler
extends AbstractResponseHandler
    This class handles a TAPIR response.

    Every TAPIR response has a few pieces of diagnostic information as defined in the specification:

    • start index of the first element in this response
    • totalReturned number of elements in this response
    • next index of the next element that should be retrieved. Used for paging. This attribute is absent if there are no more records.

    As an example. Sending a request with start=0 and limit=2 could return a response like this: 

       <summary start='0' next='2' totalReturned='2'/>

    This class is not thread-safe.

      • shouldHash

        protected boolean shouldHash(org.codehaus.stax2.XMLStreamReader2 reader)
        Description copied from class: AbstractResponseHandler
        Needs to be implemented by subclasses to indicate to the parent class what the XML element is which delimits the actual content of a result. Everything inside this element including the element itself is hashed.
        Specified by:
        shouldHash in class AbstractResponseHandler
        Returns:
        with the content element name

      • initialize

      • process

        protected void process(org.codehaus.stax2.XMLStreamReader2 reader)
                throws XMLStreamException,
                       ProtocolException
        Description copied from class: AbstractResponseHandler
        This needs to be implemented by subclasses to do actual processing on the XML data. This method is called for every single stream event (which includes whitespace etc.) so implementations need to check the event type and make sure to work on the correct elements.
        Specified by:
        process in class AbstractResponseHandler
        Parameters:
        reader - to use
        Throws:
        XMLStreamException - if there was an error with the XML parsing (e.g. invalid XML)
        ProtocolException - if there is a problem with the (well-formed) XML response (e.g. missing attribute)
